EmailTemplate.description: SSSW - Used to notify the customer that the case has been closed automatically by the system if there are no exceptions
EmailTemplate.name: SSSW Case Exception Checker Closure
EmailTemplate.subject: Missing parcel enquiry update
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Australia Post
Help & Support
Hi {!Contact.FirstName},
Thanks for your patience while we’ve conducted our investigation for your missing parcel.
Case Number: {!Case.CaseNumber}
Tracking Number: {!Case.ReferenceID__c}
We’ve checked our delivery network and found no further updates for your parcel. It hasn’t been logged at our Returned Mail Redistribution Centre, where we store undeliverable items and loose contents.
We regret to advise that despite our investigation, we haven’t been able to locate your parcel. With all possible checks completed, your parcel is now considered lost.
We had hoped to give you a happier outcome today, and we’re sorry that we couldn’t.
What to do next
Please contact the sender of your parcel. Let them know your parcel is lost and ask for assistance with your order. You can share this email with them as confirmation of your lost parcel.
You should contact the sender because they are best placed to offer you a solution according to their policies. If the sender can’t assist you, please let us know.
We sincerely apologise for any disappointment or inconvenience this may have caused you.
Kind regards, Customer Services Australia Post
Nothing in this email is intended to exclude or limit any rights or remedies that you may have under the Australian Consumer Law. For more information, visit compensation
